nl.idgis.geoide.commons.http.client

Interface HttpRequestBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultHttpRequestBuilder

    public interface HttpRequestBuilder
    Provides a fluent interface for configuring HTTP request. A request builder is typically created by the HttpClient.request() method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> execute()
      Executes the request described in this builder.
      play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> execute(HttpRequest.Method method)
      Executes the request described in this builder using the given method.
      play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> get()
      Executes the request described in this builder using the GET method.
      play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> post()
      Executes the request described in this builder using the POST method.
      play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> post(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> body)
      Executes the request described in this builder using the POST method with given body.
      HttpRequestBuilder setBody(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> body)
      Sets the body for this request.
      HttpRequestBuilder setFollowRedirects(boolean followRedirects) 
      HttpRequestBuilder setHeader(String name, String value)
      Adds a single header to this request.
      HttpRequestBuilder setMethod(HttpRequest.Method method) 
      HttpRequestBuilder setParameter(String name, String value)
      Adds a single parameter to this request.
      HttpRequestBuilder setTimeoutInMillis(long timeoutInMillis) 
      HttpRequestBuilder setUrl(String url) 

    • Method Detail

      • setUrl

        HttpRequestBuilder setUrl(String url)
        Parameters:
        url - The URL for this request. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • setMethod

        HttpRequestBuilder setMethod(HttpRequest.Method method)
        Parameters:
        method - The HTTP method for this request, cannot be null.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • setTimeoutInMillis

        HttpRequestBuilder setTimeoutInMillis(long timeoutInMillis)
        Parameters:
        timeoutInMillis - The request timeout in milliseconds. Should be a positive value.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • setFollowRedirects

        HttpRequestBuilder setFollowRedirects(boolean followRedirects)
        Parameters:
        followRedirects - Whether or not to follow redirects for this request.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • setParameter

        HttpRequestBuilder setParameter(String name,
                                String value)
        Adds a single parameter to this request. The order of parameters may be significant at the receiving end, therefore it is recommended that RequestBuilder implementations use a linked map or similar.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the parameter, cannot be null. Empty strings are not allowed.
        value - The value of the parameter, cannot be null. An empty string is allowed.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • setHeader

        HttpRequestBuilder setHeader(String name,
                             String value)
        Adds a single header to this request. The order of headers may be significant at the receiving end, therefore it is recommended that RequestBuilder implementations use a linked map or similar.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the header, cannot be null. Empty strings are not allowed.
        value - The value of the header, cannot be null. An empty string is allowed.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • setBody

        HttpRequestBuilder setBody(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> body)
        Sets the body for this request. A null value indicates that the request has no body, this is also the default if no body is provided.
        Parameters:
        body - The body for the request in the form of a reactive streams publisher.
        Returns:
        This builder.

      • execute

        play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> execute(HttpRequest.Method method)
        Executes the request described in this builder using the given method. This is similar to invoking setMethod(nl.idgis.geoide.commons.http.client.HttpRequest.Method) followed by execute()
        Parameters:
        method - The HTTP method to perform.
        Returns:
        A promise that returns the HTTP response when it becomes available, or raises an exception in case of an error.

      • execute

        play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> execute()
        Executes the request described in this builder.
        Returns:
        A promise that returns the HTTP response when it becomes available, or raises an exception in case of an error.

      • get

        play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> get()
        Executes the request described in this builder using the GET method. This is similar to invoking setMethod(nl.idgis.geoide.commons.http.client.HttpRequest.Method) with the GET method followed by execute()
        Returns:
        A promise that returns the HTTP response when it becomes available, or raises an exception in case of an error.

      • post

        play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> post()
        Executes the request described in this builder using the POST method. This is similar to invoking setMethod(nl.idgis.geoide.commons.http.client.HttpRequest.Method) with the POST method followed by execute()
        Returns:
        A promise that returns the HTTP response when it becomes available, or raises an exception in case of an error.

      • post

        play.libs.F.Promise<HttpResponse> post(org.reactivestreams.Publisher<akka.util.ByteString> body)
        Executes the request described in this builder using the POST method with given body. This is similar to invoking setMethod(nl.idgis.geoide.commons.http.client.HttpRequest.Method) with the POST method, followed by setBody(Publisher), followed by execute().
        Returns:
        A promise that returns the HTTP response when it becomes available, or raises an exception in case of an error.
